question_text: Why is it dangerous to assume the ground wire in a standard outlet is always safe to touch?
answer_options: It could be wired incorrectly and carry live current
It creates a feedback loop with capacitors
It is designed to dissipate high-frequency signals
correct_answer: It could be wired incorrectly and carry live current
explanation: Improperly wired outlets can cause the ground wire to carry voltage, posing a shock risk.
